description: Test coverage status for extends functionality

1.description: Lifecycle Inheritance - Tests comprehensive lifecycle event inheritance from base classes

lifecycleEvents.purpose: Test initial inheritance - ensures lifecycle events fire when component first loads
Test render inheritance - ensures lifecycle events fire on each render cycle
Test state-change inheritance - ensures lifecycle events fire when state updates

2.description: Multi-Level Lifecycle Inheritance - Tests lifecycle events through inheritance chains (Component → Base → GrandparentBase)

lifecycleEvents.purpose: Test lifecycle inheritance through multiple inheritance levels
Test render lifecycle inheritance in multi-level chains
Test update lifecycle inheritance with super() call chains

3.description: Abstract Base Class Inheritance - Components extending Stencil-decorated abstract classes

4.description: Component-to-Component Inheritance - Components extending other component classes

5.description: External Library Inheritance - Components extending classes from external Stencil libraries

6.description: Mixin Composition - Components extending via Stencil Mixin function for behavior composition

7.description: Controller-Initiated Updates - Base class triggering host component updates (ClockController pattern)

controllerFeatures.description: Base class calls abstract requestUpdate() method - simulates Lit's this.host.requestUpdate()
@State lives on component, not controller - component controls its own state updates
Controller requests updates, doesn't force them - component decides how to respond

8.description: FloatingUI Controller - Real-world reactive controller for Popper.js integration (Bricks components)

controllerFeatures.description: Controller creates and manages Popper class instance in componentDidLoad lifecycle
Provides update()/updateInstance() methods to replace updatePopoverInstance() in host components
Handles popper.destroy() cleanup in disconnectedCallback
Used by bricks-tooltip and bricks-menu-button components from Bricks component library

9.description: ValidationController - Real-world reactive controller for form validation (Bricks components)

controllerFeatures.description: Controller maintains validation errors, isValid, and isDirty states
onBlur handling, validation timing, and error rendering shared across components
Host components define validation logic via abstract validateValue() method
Used by bricks-radio-button-group and bricks-checkbox-group components

7.description: Event Handling Inheritance - @Listen decorators and event propagation through inheritance chains

eventFeatures.description: Multiple @Listen decorators at different inheritance levels - event handling order and precedence
How custom events bubble through inheritance chains and component hierarchies
Document and window listeners in base classes vs component-specific listeners
When base class and component define same event handler - which executes and in what order

8.description: Watch Decorator Inheritance - @Watch behavior through inheritance chains and reactive patterns

watchFeatures.description: Multiple @Watch decorators for same property at different inheritance levels
Order of watch handler execution: base class first, component second, or override behavior
Watch handlers triggering other property changes through inheritance hierarchy
When base class and component both watch same property - execution behavior and conflicts

9.description: Controller-Initiated Updates - Base class triggering host component updates (ClockController pattern)

controllerFeatures.description: Base class calls abstract requestUpdate() method - simulates Lit's this.host.requestUpdate()
@State lives on component, not controller - component controls its own state updates
Controller requests updates, doesn't force them - component decides how to respond

10.description: FloatingUI Controller - Real-world reactive controller for Popper.js integration (Bricks components)

controllerFeatures.description: Controller creates and manages Popper class instance in componentDidLoad lifecycle
Provides update()/updateInstance() methods to replace updatePopoverInstance() in host components
Handles popper.destroy() cleanup in disconnectedCallback
Used by bricks-tooltip and bricks-menu-button components from Bricks component library

11.description: ValidationController - Real-world reactive controller for form validation (Bricks components)

controllerFeatures.description: Controller maintains validation errors, isValid, and isDirty states
onBlur handling, validation timing, and error rendering shared across components
Host components define validation logic via abstract validateValue() method
Used by bricks-radio-button-group and bricks-checkbox-group components

12.description: Decorator Conflicts & Edge Cases - Testing inheritance chain conflicts and compiler behavior

conflictScenarios.description: Same prop name defined in base class and component - compiler precedence rules
Same state name defined in base class and component - runtime behavior and conflicts
Same method name defined in base class and component - override behavior
Same name used as @Prop in base, @State in component - compiler error handling
Unsupported inheritance scenarios and error conditions
Verify appropriate compiler errors for invalid decorator conflicts

13.description: SSR & Hydration - Server-side rendering and hydration behavior with inheritance chains

ssrFeatures.description: How inheritance chains render on the server - component hierarchy and lifecycle execution
Client-side hydration of server-rendered components with inheritance - state synchronization
Handling differences between server and client rendering of inherited components
Critical for enterprise applications using SSR - ensure inheritance works in production
